Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view

Class GUIClientView

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.network.Observable
it.polimi.ingsw.view.View
it.polimi.ingsw.view.GUIClientView
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer
public class GUIClientView
extends View
This class represents the GUI client-side view component of the application. It is separated from the ClientView to better handle the different input modalities that the GUI offers

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    GUIClientView​(ClientConnection connection)

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void askChoice​(java.lang.String question, java.lang.String opTrue, java.lang.String opFalse)
    Prints a true/false question (according to the methodology of this view element) that accepts only 2 possible answers, specified as arguments.
    void highlightTiles​(java.util.List<Position> positionsToHighlight)
    Highlights the specified positions of the game's Board according to the methodology of this view element.
    void init()
    This method tries to initialize this GUIClientView, attempting the connection to the server.
    void logMessage​(java.lang.String message)
    Prints an informative message about recent game actions to the main output of this view element stdout for ClientView relative graphical element for GUIClientView socket output stream for RemoteView

    Prints an informative message about recent game actions to the main output of this view element, but only to the current Player if specified stdout for ClientView relative graphical element for GUIClientView socket output stream for RemoteView

    Prints a warning (in the main output of this view element) in response of an illegal input forwarded by the user, that resulted in a suppressed action.

  • Method Details

    • sendEvent

      public void sendEvent​(Event event)
      This method tries to send the specified event on the connection associated with this view component. If any network issue occurs (resulting in a DisconnectedException both the connection and the GUI components are closed
      Parameters:
      event -

    • init

      public void init()
      This method tries to initialize this GUIClientView, attempting the connection to the server. If any network issue occurs (resulting in a DisconnectedException both the connection and the GUI components are closed

    • update

      public void update​(Event arg)
      Receives events from an Observable observed by this view element and handles them, based on their specific type. After determining the nature of the notification, update proceeds to unpack the Event, extracts the relevant information (e.g., a list of changes, a message to print, ...) and calls the most suitable handling method. The view shouldn't receive
      • ActionEvents
      • PingEvents
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer
      Overrides:
      update in class View
      Parameters:
      arg - The event representing details of the received notification

    • readEvent

      public Event readEvent()
      Description copied from class: View
      Reads an object (Event) from the main input of this view element
      • stdin for ClientView
      • inferred graphical element for GUIClientView
      • socket input stream for RemoteView
      Specified by:
      readEvent in class View
      Returns:
      The event read from the input source

    • processInput

      public Event processInput​(java.lang.String inputLine)
      This method is used to process the input line read from the main scene text field, to map it onto an event type to send through the connection
      Parameters:
      inputLine - the string read from the text field that has to be parsed
      Returns:
      an Event, resulting from the parsing of the specified string

    • updateBoard

      public void updateBoard​(java.util.List<Tile> tilesToUpdate)
      Updates the copy of the current game's Board kept by this view element with the specified list of changes. Immediately after a board update, its representation should be refreshed according to the methodology of this view element.
      Specified by:
      updateBoard in class View
      Parameters:
      tilesToUpdate - The list of Tile that have been updated

    • highlightTiles

      public void highlightTiles​(java.util.List<Position> positionsToHighlight)
      Highlights the specified positions of the game's Board according to the methodology of this view element.
      Specified by:
      highlightTiles in class View
      Parameters:
      positionsToHighlight - The list of Position that have to be highlighted

    • askChoice

      public void askChoice​(java.lang.String question, java.lang.String opTrue, java.lang.String opFalse)
      Prints a true/false question (according to the methodology of this view element) that accepts only 2 possible answers, specified as arguments. Ideally, until a valid answer to the question is given, this view element should filter and block all playing inputs (treating them as invalid or simply ignoring them), while letting pass the more general ones, like "quit".
      Specified by:
      askChoice in class View
      Parameters:
      question - The string representing the question to be asked
      opTrue - The string representing the textual answer for true
      opFalse - The string representing the textual answer for false

    • printError

      public void printError​(java.lang.String warning, boolean currentPlayerReserved)
      Prints a warning (in the main output of this view element) in response of an illegal input forwarded by the user, that resulted in a suppressed action.
      • stdout for ClientView
      • relative graphical element for GUIClientView
      • socket output stream for RemoteView
      Note that this kinds of events are always reserved to the current player, with the exception of disconnection notification.
      Specified by:
      printError in class View
      Parameters:
      warning - The string representing the textual message to be printed
      currentPlayerReserved - Specify if the message is reserved for the current player

    • setGameOver

      public void setGameOver()
      Notifies that the game has resolved to a winner and it's about to be shutdown. This is always the last message send during a match.
      Specified by:
      setGameOver in class View

    • setCurrentPlayer

      public void setCurrentPlayer​(java.lang.String newCurrentPlayerNick)
      Notifies the new current player'identity, specified through its nickname. Related to the start of a turn.
      Specified by:
      setCurrentPlayer in class View
      Parameters:
      newCurrentPlayerNick - Current player's nickname

    • setChallenger

      public void setChallenger​(java.lang.String nickname)
      Notifies the challenger's identity to the players, specified through its nickname. This is sent once during game initialization.
      Specified by:
      setChallenger in class View
      Parameters:
      nickname - Challenger's nickname

    • setNickname

      public void setNickname​(java.lang.String acceptedNickname)
      Notifies the client that the nickname insert has been accepted by the Server. More of an ack than actual "setting" communication.
      Specified by:
      setNickname in class View
      Parameters:
      acceptedNickname - Client's nickname as double check

    • setNPlayers

      public void setNPlayers​(int acceptedNPlayers)
      Notifies the client that the lobby size (2 or 3) chosen has been accepted by the Server. More of an ack than actual "setting" communication.
      Specified by:
      setNPlayers in class View
      Parameters:
      acceptedNPlayers - Lobby size specified by the client as a double check

    • setSelectedCard

      public void setSelectedCard​(EGodPower selectedCard)
      Notifies the client a Card, identified through their specific god, that has been chosen and will be present during the game.
      Specified by:
      setSelectedCard in class View
      Parameters:
      selectedCard - God relative the chosen card

      public void setTurnPhase​(ETurnPhase turnPhase)

      Specified by:
      setTurnPhase in class View
      Parameters:
      turnPhase - Turn phase currently taking place

    • printInstructions

      public void printInstructions()
      Prints turnphase-specific information to the client. This info is different for the player actually playing this turn vs the "spectators"

    • setLoser

      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      loserNickname - Losing player's nickname
